results.title: Australian made
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, John McLean, Tom Hegarty Productions and Captured Live Productions
results.brief_description: Australian music came of age in the summer of 1987 when the cream of Oz rock swept the continent for the most ambitious series of open air concerts ever staged beneath the Southern Cross. Almost 140,000 fans in six cities were entertained with a diverse array of potent and imaginative rock - from understated avant-garde to tempestuous thunder from Down Under. The dynamic performances and behind-the-scenes activity of the tour has generated an exciting, fast paced and imaginative feature film. Includes performances by: INXS ; Jimmy Barnes ; The Triffids ; I’m Talking ; The Saints ; The Divinyls and The Models.

results.title: Australian lizards
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the five families of lizards found in Australia: goannas, dragons, skinks, geckoes and legless lizards. Illustrates the differences in size, shape, colour and pattern. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Australian Landscape Painters (Italian Version)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Art”.
The Australian artist has no greater challenge than his own landscape, but few have been completely successful in depicting it. Using both the artists’ words and their work, this film studies such men as Russell Drysdale, Tom Roberts and Sir Heysen, and shows why and how they have transmuted landscape into art

results.title: Australian is a wide word
results.brief_description: Perhaps the most pertinent issue of this video is why some or many of us have difficulties defining the term “Australian”, particularly in describing ourselves. The title is the response of one person in the video to this issue.

results.title: Australian identity. Yrs 7-10
results.brief_description: A program presented in ten segments on the Australian identity. 1. What’s an identity? 2. What’s an Australian? 3. Popular legends. 4. Aboriginal identity. 5. People left out of our legends. 6. Defiance of authority. 7. The Anzac legend. 8. White colonial Australia. 9. Legends about women. 10. Changing national identity. Uses extracts from early Australian feature films and stills to focus on the question of who are Australians.

results.title: Australian heritage [compilation]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “National Trust”.
Old Parramatta - after Sydney, the oldest city in Australia. Historic Hawksbury - the valley was settled shortly after the arrival of the First Fleet in 1788. Elizabeth Bay House - an outstanding example of colonial architecture. Goolwa - a town near the mouth of the Murray in South Australia. Kurralta - a famous historic house near Adelaide. Marion - a River Murray paddle steamer.
